unicode.value: Leonardo Da Vinci y el inglés
Introducción: Carmen Tejada Casado; Activities: Cristina Sánchez Fernández; Boarding Pass to Vinci: Sandra Martínez Pérez;

En este Recurso Educativo, para alumnado de 3º de Inglés de Educación Secundaria Obligatoria se vincula a la figura del gran Leonardo da Vinci.
En la sesión de Activities se trabajan más actividades de readings, listenings and videos de Leonardo da Vinci.
La sesión "Boarding Pass to Vinci" tiene dos objetivos: movilizar al alumnado a buscar y seleccionar alternativas para realizar las diferentes partes de un plan de viaje y realizar una presentación de este utilizando un lenguaje persuasivo. Para ello, el alumnado activará y ampliará su repertorio léxico, de estructuras sintácticas y desarrollará las habilidades necesarias para organizar, persuadir y presentar su plan. El alumnado elaborará en grupo un plan de viaje por escrito, en formato digital o papel. A continuación, lo presentará oralmente con el objetivo de convencer a la clase de realizar este viaje.
Leonardo Da Vinci y el inglés

En este proyecto de 3ºESO que es la continuación del proyecto comenzado con 2ºESO, seguiremos desarrollando actividades y tareas en base a la figura de Leonardo Da Vinci para la adquisición de la lengua inglesa por parte del alumnado

Leonardo di ser Piero da Vinci (15 April 1452 – 2 May 1519) was an Italian polymath of the High Renaissance who was active as a painter, draughtsman, engineer, scientist, theorist, sculptor, and architect. While his fame initially rested on his achievements as a painter, he has also become known for his notebooks, in which he made drawings and notes on a variety of subjects, including anatomy, astronomy, botany, cartography, painting, and paleontology.
Activity 1
READ THE FOLLOWING TEXT TO KNOW MORE INFO

Motus dice ... How much do your classmates know?

When we work in a group, we also learn as a team. 

There are classmates who remember a lot of things, others who speak very well, others who are very skilled with their hands or feet, others who are great at drawing. 

We all have superpowers, but when we combine them, we learn together and we can solve any challenge. 

That's why it's important that your team follows these tips: 

  • Everything one person knows is shared with others.
  • We collaborate on tasks to make the team work.
  • We value each person's superpowers.
  • We respect what each person brings to the team.

1. WHEN WAS THE PIECE CREATED?

2. WHERE IS THE PIECE LOCATED?

3. WHAT DOES THE PIECE REPRESENT?

4. IT HAS DIFFERENT NAMES: WHICH ONES?
Watch the video and write down 5 important facts of his life

Plan your own trip to Vinci, the place where Leonardo da Vinci was born! Include transport, accommodation, exciting activities, and food.

You have a budget of €600 to cover the total cost. Are you ready to take off?

Definition:

The amount of money you expect to spend.

La cantidad de dinero que se espera gastar.

Example:

The team had a 500 euro budget to design their new project.

El equipo tenía un presupuesto de 500 euros para diseñar el nuevo proyecto.

Definition:

To leave the ground to start flying.

Dejar el suelo para empezar a volar.

Example:

The plane didn’t take off on time because there was a storm.

El avión no despegó a tiempo porque había una tormenta.
Click here to read the subtitles

• Do you understand the quote from the beginning? 
  • Would you like to sail away from your safe harbour and explore, dream and discover Vinci, the place where the famous artist, inventor, philosopher was born?
  • What means of transport were used in the past taking into account the video?
  • What means of transport are commonly used nowadays and which one would you use to go to Vinci?
  • o go?
Definition:

A place near the coast where ships and boats are kept.

Un lugar cerca de la costa donde se anclan los barcos.

Example:

All the boats stayed in the harbour for three days because there was a tsunami alert.

Todos los barcos se anclaron en el puerto durante tres días porque había alerta de tsunami.

Definition:

To control a boat or ship. To travel in a boat or ship.

Controlar un barco. Viajar en barco.

Example:

Captain Sven has been sailing the seas for thirty years.

El capitán Sven ha estado navegando los mares durante treinta años.

Feel confident!

Doing activities with a group of friends gives you a sense of belonging which, in turn, helps you to feel good. 

You need friends who come up with fun activities and then organise them. But why shouldn’t you try to be the organiser? 

You may have some experiences from an event as a birthday surprise you organised in the past.

All previous experiences will help you.  

Be confident and develop your skills as an organiser. Moving Around is here to help you!
3. What are we going to learn?

With our Boarding Pass to Vinci you are going to learn to: 

  • Search information to plan your trip to Vinci while investigating about Leonardo´s achievements.
  • Organize your trip.
  • Write a travel plan.
  • Design a presentation.
  • Persuade your classmates to participate in the proposed trip.

Audio

Before preparing our travel to Vinci, let´s answers these questions:

Have you ever gone on a trip with your family or friends? Where did you go? Who did you go with? 

What did you do? Can you tell some anecdotes? Let’s share our best experiences! 

The things that you remember at this stage will help you with the final task.

Definition:

The itinerary from one place to another.

El itinerario de un lugar a otro.

Example:

The children enjoyed the trip.

Los niños y niñas disfrutaron del viaje.

Definition:

Use something together.

Usar algo juntos o juntas.

Example:

We share the same room.

Compartimos la misma habitación.

Maybe you keep pictures, souvenirs or just good memories from one of your past trips. Bring one of them to class and talk to your classmates about it.

Definition:

The mental capacity of remembering something or someone.

La capacidad mental de recordar algo o a alguien.

Example:

He has good memories of his school trip.

Tiene buenos recuerdos de su viaje de estudios.

You can talk about...

- Destination.

- Travellers.

- Means of transportation.

- Activities.

- Anecdotes or stories.

- Budget or cost.

- Overall feeling.

Lumen dice...

Puedes hablar de:

  • Destinos.
  • Viajeros.
  • Medios de transporte.
  • Actividades y anécdotas.
  • Coste.
  • Cómo te sentiste en general.

Your travel memories or expectations

Remember your last trip or that day out in the city, in the country or at the beach. 

If you can’t think of anything or you can’t find any pictures, you can search the Internet for some pictures of a trip that represents yours or that you would like to do.

How did it feel?

How did you feel when you saw a beautiful view? 

How do you feel when you do a fun activity with friends?

Before packing our suitcase, we should ask ourselves two questions. 

What kind of activities are we going to do at Vinci? 

What will we need to carry out these activities?

Our destination is Vinci, but, what do we know about this place?  It may be hot or cold there?  The following activities will help you think about different activities and the items you will need to carry them out.
Investigate about the different activities and items you will need to enjoy Vinci as much as Leonardo.
Option B: Choose your travel friend

1. Look at your travel friend 

Look at the pictures of Ana and Maria. They are leaving soon. What activity do you think they will do?

Ana

Possible answers:

Ana: She likes hiking. She enjoys playing the guitar. She likes spending time in nature. 

María: She loves travelling. She likes travelling by plane. Maybe she enjoys the city.

María

2. Listen to your travel friend

Listen to Ana and María who are getting ready for their next trip. Who do you think is Ana? And who is María?

Track 1     


Track 2   

Who do you want to go with? Why?

Which activities would you like to do with them?
Option C: Dare to record your experience
Think of your best travelling experience. What did you do? Explain why you liked it and record yourself.

If you have never been on a trip, click here…

Think of a place not very far from you: a nearby town, the beach, the country or a museum.

If you have never been on holiday, don’t worry, try to imagine it!

In the previous section, you have talked about lots of activities you can do in different places.

What about your town? Does it have something in common with Vinci? What can you do there?

You will have the chance to welcome exchange students in your town and make a two-day plan for them. This experience will help you in the final task.

Your school has been given an amount of money -€100  per student- to do an exchange with another school. Fifteen students from Vinci, the place where Leonardo da Vinci was, are going to visit your place for 2 days. What are you going to plan for them? 

What are you going to advise them to pack in their suitcase?

In small groups, draw and write down what you are going to recommend during their stay. Make up a travel plan for the exchange students. When you finish, present your travel plan to your classmates. Vote for your favourite one.

Definition:

A quantity of something.

Una cantidad de algo.

Example:

Sport gives an enormous amount of pleasure to many people.

El deporte da una enorme cantidad de placer a mucha gente.

Definition:

Students who attend a school in another country.

Estudiantes que asisten a una escuela en otro país.

Example:

We hosted two exchange students last year.

El año pasado alojamos dos estudiantes de intercambio.

Definition:

A period of remaining in the same place.

Un periodo en el que se permanece en el mismo lugar.

Example:

They planned a short stay at a hotel to celebrate their birthday.

Ellos planificaron una estancia corta en un hotel para celebrar sus cumpleaños.

Do you need help? Use this template!

Use this template to help you plan your visit.

You can find the places you can visit, the means of transport you need to take and the money that each item costs you. 

This template will help you calculate how many euros the trip will cost you.


Click here to download the document.

What do I need for this activity?

  • Places to go.
  • Means of transport to go to those places.
  • Budget (money to spend).

If you are going to search for this information on the internet, keep in mind where and how to look for information.

Click this link if you want to know more: Information search| Digital competence guide (juntadeandalucia.es)
2. Identify what I have to do

You already know what your challenge is and the activity that will bring you closer to the goal. But to succeed in your journey, you will need some strategies that will help you in this and other similar tasks. You will discover them in a diary that we call your Learning Journal. 

This time we suggest you open it and complete STEP 1 of the Learning Journal before you start the activity you have just read about!

Click here to download your Learning Journal.

Remember: 

- Ask your teacher whether you will fill it in on paper or on the computer. 

- If you fill it in on the computer, don't forget to save it on your computer when you finish it! Cheer up, you'll do great!

¿Necesitas más ayuda?

Ya conoces qué reto te proponemos alcanzar y te acabamos de plantear una actividad que te acercará a la meta. Pero para tener éxito en tu camino, necesitarás algunas estrategias que te servirán para esta y otras tareas parecidas. Las irás descubriendo en un diario que llamamos tu Diario de aprendizaje. En esta ocasión te proponemos que lo abras y completes el PASO 1 del Diario de aprendizaje antes de empezar la actividad que acabas de leer.

Haz clic aquí para descargar tu Diario de aprendizaje.

Recuerda: Pregunta a tu profesor o profesora si rellenarás la ficha en papel o en el ordenador. Si la rellenas en el ordenador, ¡no te olvides de guardarla en tu ordenador cuando lo termines! 

¡Ánimo, que lo harás genial!
3. Have I been able to do the activity?

You have already finished the activity "Welcome"! The beginnings may have caused fear and insecurity.

If you complete STEP 2 of the Learning Journal (Will I be able to do it?), you will see that those feelings are common when you start a task and reflecting on this will help you reduce your insecurities in the next activities. 

Remember:

 - Ask your teacher whether you will fill it in on paper or on the computer.

 - If you fill it in on the computer, don't forget to save it on your computer when you finish it!

 Cheer up, you'll do great!

¿Necesitas más ayuda?

¡Ya has terminado la actividad "Welcome"! Los comienzos te han podido crear miedos e inseguridades a la hora de realizarla. 

Si completas el PASO 2 del Diario de aprendizaje (¿Seré capaz de hacerlo?) podrás ver que tus sentimientos son habituales cuando empezamos una tarea y reflexionar sobre ello te ayudará a que en las próximas actividades esa inseguridad sea cada vez menor. 

Recuerda: 

• Pregunta a tu profesor o profesora si rellenarás la ficha en papel o en el ordenador. 

• Si la rellenas en el ordenador, ¡no te olvides de guardarla en tu ordenador cuando la termines! 

¡Ánimo, que lo harás genial!

You are leaving soon and to have a successful trip, we need a well-organised travel plan.

I have chosen the following contents to help you prepare your own travel plan, to present it in class and to persuade your fellow students of your destination.
1. What you need to know to prepare and present the best travel plan

Parts of a travel plan and vocabulary related to trips

What are we going to include in the travel plan? Learn words related to means of transport, accommodation, costs, possible activities and luggage.

Talking about travelling and using future, imperative, modal verbs and first conditional

Are you going to talk about the possibilities that your trip offers? Practice the use of modal verbs (can, may, might). Are you also going to include when the activities are going to take place? Learn how to use the future tenses and the first conditional to talk about travelling.

Persuasive language

How are you going to convince your classmates that your travel plan is the best? Maybe you need to know how to persuade, that is to say, how to use descriptive and positive adjectives, imperative, slogans, repeating words and emotive language.

A good presentation

How are you going to tell your classmates your ideas? Have a look at these tips to prepare a good design for the written travel plan and a good oral presentation.

Plan to feel good!

Take small steps to reach big goals.

To reach a goal, you need to be a good strategist. That is to say, you need to know methods, techniques, or "tricks" to get to where you want to be sooner or easier. Now I'm going to teach you a strategy, take advantage of it to reach your challenge!

You will find this strategy very useful to organize yourself, as it will help you to focus and learn what you need to know to create your travel plan. If you need help, click here. 

I am sure you'll do great!

¿Necesitas más ayuda?

Para llegar a una meta, es conveniente que seas un buen o una buena estratega. Es decir, tener métodos, técnicas o “trucos” para llegar antes o de forma más fácil donde tú quieres. Ahora te voy a enseñar una estrategia. ¡Aprovéchala para alcanzar tu reto!

Esta estrategia te resultará muy útil para organizarte, ya que te ayudará a concentrarte y aprender lo que necesitas saber para crear tu plan de viaje. Si necesitas ayuda, haz clic aquí.

 ¡Ánimo, que lo harás genial!

It is time to prepare and present your travel plan to Vinci. 

Take into account everything you have learnt before. 

Three, two, one… get ready!

In this last step, I am going to ask you to think about what has been the most important thing you have learnt in order to achieve the challenge.

What you discover by thinking, will help you when you have to meet similar challenges in the future. 

Stop for a moment and complete STEP 4 of your Learning Journal (What have I learned?). 

Remember:

 - Ask your teacher whether you will fill it in on paper or on the computer.

 - If you fill it in on the computer, don't forget to save it on your computer when you finish it! 

Cheer up, you'll do great!

¿Necesitas más ayuda?

En este último paso te voy a proponer que pienses en qué ha sido lo más importante de todo lo que has aprendido para conseguir el reto que te proponíamos. 

Lo que descubras pensando en ello te servirá para cuando tengas que alcanzar retos parecidos en un futuro. 

Para un momento y completa el PASO 4 de tu Diario de aprendizaje (¿Qué he aprendido?).

Recuerda: 

• Pregunta a tu profesor o profesora si rellenarás la ficha en papel o en el ordenador. 

• Si la rellenas en el ordenador, ¡no te olvides de guardarla en tu ordenador cuando la termines!

¡Ánimo, que lo harás genial!

Now it’s time to plan your trip to Vinci. You will work in small groups. Remember you have a budget of €600 per student. Prepare your oral presentation and convince your classmates to join the trip. Follow these steps:

Decide about the parts and content of your plan

  • Why and when do you want to travel to Vinci?
  • Which parts are you going to include?  
  • Considering your destination, can you think of any other important part or information that makes your plan different?
  • Check on what you learnt before.

Search for the information you need

  • Use authentic and reliable websites (i.e. official tourism websites.)
  • Take a note of the information you want to use (on paper or on a digital document.)

 Write down your plan

  • Use your own words.
  • Check on the use of future tenses. 
  • Check on the vocabulary related to trips.

Design your visual support

  • Include only your main points.
  • Choose your colours wisely.
  • Create original slides.
  • Use visuals.

Write the text that can help you when presenting

  • Use persuasive techniques. If you need help, click here.
  • Use positive and descriptive adjectives.
  • Use catchy phrases.
  • Choose powerful words.

Decide who is going to present each part and how you are going to distribute your time

  • Who is going to start? Who is going to continue?
  • Time each section of the presentation.

Present your plan and try to convince your classmates

  • Be engaging.
  • Eye-contact is really important.
  • Speak clearly. 
  • Check on what you learnt before.

Keys to make a good travel plan

Checklist

Click here to download the document.

Do you need help to continue?

You are almost there. Go for it!

In this section we are going to practice with the words that we have seen in the previous section. 

All of them are related to travel experiences. 

They may help you when planning your tour.
It is always good to know what to say when planning a trip. These vocabulary and exersices will help you.
Write as many sentences as you can that include the vocabulary below to describe how you want to plan your travel.
Translate the following vocabulary. Write sentences about your trip to Vinci.

Imagine you are a travel agent and you are talking to two customers who want to spend a weekend in Vinci. They need transport, accommodation and a couple of activities. Think of a good plan for them and record yourself. Use the images to help you and look for the words you need.

OPTION A)

OPTION B)
Attention please! My travel plan!

Become a good presenter!

Did you know that people who are good at giving presentations often get more possibilities in life? Being or not being good at talking to an audience is not a talent you are born with but a skill you can learn. Now it’s time to develop our presentation skills. How? By giving presentations because “the more presentations you give, the better you become.”

 

"Hi, I am Grace. I work at a travel agency. An important part of my job is presenting different travel plans. In my first presentations, I was very nervous but these tips helped me a lot. Let’s have a closer look at them."

Tip 1: Planning (written)

  • Choose your topic (my best school trip) and decide your central message.
  • Choose what kind of presentation you want to design: an informative one, a humorous one or a story.

Tip 2: Preparation (visual support)

  • Do research or remember the experience.
  • Write a basic structure: think of the main points related to your central message.
  • Add details. 

Visual Support

Visual support should include:

  • Front and back slide.
  • The different parts of a travel plan.
  • Short sentences.
  • A selection of vivid images, videos or audios, copyright-free or from your album.
  • A good choice of fonts: type, size, colour, position, etc.

Check that your visual support is not too busy!

Tip 3: Practice (oral)

  • Practice is very important. It helps you spot mistakes and make changes. 
  • It allows you to appreciate how long the presentation will take. Avoid reading from the screen.
    The more you practice, the better your presentation is.

Tip 4: Performance

All the hard work is done! So, there is nothing to be nervous about.

  • Eye contact helps to catch attention, therefore, look at your classmates. 
  • You can also ask them questions. This makes your presentation more interactive. 
  • Don’t worry about small mistakes, just continue… 
  • and … don’t forget to smile!

To sum up:

Definition:

To make it possible for something to take place or for a person to do or say something.

Posibilitar que algo tenga lugar o que una persona pueda hacer o decir algo.

Example:

The teacher allowed the students to use the pencil to take the exam.

El profesor permitió que los alumnos utilizaran el lápiz para hacer el examen.

Definition:

To stop oneself from doing something.

Impedir que ocurra algo.

Example:

I avoid studying at night.

Evito estudiar de noche.

Definition:

Finding out where something or someone is.

Averiguar el lugar en el que se encuentra algo o alguien.

Example:

The student spotted the errors in the sentences of the exercise.

El estudiante localizó los errores en las frases del ejercicio.
2. Passengers onboard, may I have your attention, please?
The cabin crew has prepared these activities for you. If you want to become the best presenter, go ahead!

Imagine you are the delegate of your class and you have been attending a meeting with the principal of the school, who suggests that you may go on an excursion. You wrote down the following notes:

Record yourself presenting the information.

Definition:

Person in charge of leading and managing an entity or activity.

Persona encargada del mando y gestión de una entidad o actividad.

Example:

The school principal presented the activities.

La directora del colegio presentó las actividades.

Read the following notes about the schedule for a special day about environmentally-friendly schools. Decide which one you would choose to present the activity to your classmates. Use the following items:

  • The handwriting is clear enough.
  • The ideas are well-organised.
  • The information is complete.
Option A Option B

Trust yourself...

Self-confidence is the best tool.

Think of one of your strengths and keep on working!

Do you need more details to improve your presentation?

Have a look at the guide to compose oral and written texts here:

Guía para elaborar textos orales y escritos.

Everything you learn helps you achieve the goals you set for yourself. Reflect for a moment on all you have learned so far. Complete STEP 3 of your Learning Journal (I review what I have learned). 

Remember:

- Ask your teacher whether you will fill it in on paper or on the computer. 

- If you fill it in on the computer, don't forget to save it on your computer when you finish it! Cheer up, you'll do great!

¿Necesitas más ayuda?

Reflexiona un momento sobre todo lo que has aprendido hasta llegar aquí. Y completa el PASO 3 de tu Diario de aprendizaje (Reviso lo aprendido).

Recuerda: 

• Pregunta a tu profesor o profesora si rellenarás la ficha en papel o en el ordenador. 

• Si la rellenas en el ordenador, ¡no te olvides de guardarla en tu ordenador cuando la termines! 

¡Ánimo, que lo harás genial!

On behalf of the Leonardo da Vinci´s Airlines and the entire crew, I’d like to thank you for joining us on this trip and we are looking forward to seeing you on board again in the near future.

Don’t forget your personal belongings. Have a nice stay!

Definition:

Expression by which it is stated that a person acts representing another one.

Locución por la que se hace constar que una persona actúa en representación de otra.

Example:

The father signed the authorization on behalf of his son.

El padre firmó la autorización en nombre de su hijo.

Search information about Vinci to plan our trip

Organize our trip

Write a travel plan

Design a persuasive presentation

Help our classmates to participate in our Vinci trip

You have also shown good searching and planning abilities. And you have put into practice your communicative and persuasive skills. No doubt this can help you in other situations:

  • Your graduation ceremony is coming soon, use the abilities and skills acquired throughout this challenge to organise an unforgettable ceremony. 
  • You would like to have a place where you can sit during breaktime, convince your principal to place some benches around the playground.
  • In your school, there are very few green places. So far, you have been told that there is not enough space for a garden but some school walls are ideal for a “vertical garden”. Find out more about the cost, maintenance, etc of such a garden.
Definition:

Long seat on which two or more people can sit.

Asiento largo en el que pueden sentarse dos o más personas.

Example:

The old man sat on a bench after walking for an hour.

El anciano se sentó en un banco después de caminar una hora.

Have you heard about these European initiatives?

Great ways to move around: https://europa.eu/youth/discovereu_es 

Your school can organise an exchange with another school abroad. Maybe you can be offered financial support.

Would you like to participate in an ERASMUS + project? Click here.

rubric
 ExcellentGoodNeeds improvementLow performance
1. You can create an outline of a travel plan in a clear and logical way. Your travel plan includes all the relevant parts and the content is clear and logical. (10)Your travel plan includes all the relevant parts but the content is not always clear or logical. (7.5)Your travel plan does not include all the relevant parts and the content is not always clear or logical. (5)Your travel plan is not developed. (2.5)
2. You can write a coherent plan, using a variety of expressions and structures related to trips.You write a coherent plan using a great variety of expressions and structures related to trips (10)You write a coherent plan using some expressions and structures related to trips. (7.5)You write a plan, but some of the expressions and structures related to trips are not used correctly (5)You do not write a good plan. (2.5)
3. You can design a visual support for your presentation.You design a very harmonious and not too busy presentation with a front and back slides, short sentences, adequate fonts and vivid images or videos. (10)You design a good presentation with a front and back slides, short sentences, adequate fonts and vivid images or videos. (7.5)You design a presentation, but it lacks some of the elements: there is not a front or back slides, the sentences are too long, the fonts are not adequate enough or the images and videos are not vivid. (5)You design a very simple presentation, lacking most of the elements: there is not a front or back slides, the sentences are not short, the fonts are not adequate enough and the images and videos are not vivid. (2.5)
4. You can use proper spelling and punctuation in your visual support. Your visual support has no spelling or punctuation mistakes. (10)Your visual support has few spelling or punctuation mistakes. (7.5)Your visual support has some spelling or punctuation mistakes. (5)Your visual support has numerous spelling or punctuation mistakes. (2.5)
5. You can control time and turns during the presentation. Your contribution to the presentation is excellent. (10)Your contribution to the presentation is good, however, you read too much from your visual support. (7.5)Your oral presentation lacks time control. (5)There is no time, nor turn control in the oral presentation of your group. (2.5)
6. You can talk about different aspects of a trip, using the appropriate vocabulary.You present your travel plan fluently using a variety of vocabulary related to the topic. (10)you present your travel plan using some vocabulary related to the topic. ( (7.5)You presesnt your travel plan with considerable hesitation using a limited amount of vocabulary related to the topic. (5)Your contribution to the oral presentation is minimal. Your vocabulary is very limited and not specific to the topic. (2.5)
7. You can talk about future activities from key words.You talk about activities using a great variety of tenses with future meaning without support. (10)You talk about activities using a number of tenses with future meaning with the support of key words (7.5)Your oral expression about activities using the tenses with future meaning is minimal. (5)You talk about future activities reading everything from the support using a limited amount of tenses with future meaning. (2.5)
8. You can use emotive language to persuade your classmates during your presentation.You use emotive language to persuade your classmates appropriately (10)You are aware of the use of emotive language when trying to persuade your classmates during the presentation, but you don't use it appropriately some of the time (7.5)You have some awareness of emotive language when trying to persuade your classmates during your presentation but you don't use it appropriately (5)You have no control of emotive language when trying to persuade your classmates during the presentation. (2.5)
9. You can present your travel plan with good pronunciation.You use clear and precise pronunciation when presenting your travel plan. (10)You pronounce most of the words correctly when presenting your travel plan. However, a few minor mispronunciations can be heard. (7.5)You pronounce some terms incorrectly. Some major mispronunciations can be heard. (5)Most pronunciation sounds are incomprehensible when presenting your travel plan (2.5)
10. You can listen to your classmates' travel plan and identify its strengths and weaknesses.You identify the strengths and weaknesses of your classmates' travel plans precisely. (10)You identify some of the strengths and weaknesses of your classmates' travel plans. (7.5)You identify some of the strengths and weaknesses of your classmates' travel plans occasionally (5)You are unable to identify the strengths and weaknesses of your classmates' travel plans. (2.5)
  • Actividad
  • Nombre
  • Fecha
  • Puntuación
  • Notas
  • Reiniciar
  • Imprimir
  • Aplicar
  • Ventana nueva

To conclude, let's remember the strategy or "trick" that you have learned during this challenge. 

We taught you this strategy or "trick" and you worked on it in the section “Fasten your seatbelts”. Go back to that section and review for a moment what it consisted of and how it helped you achieve the challenge we proposed. Now open the Learning Journal and complete the last page. 

In this section you will keep valuable information about the strategy, in which activities you have applied it, whether it has been useful and what has been the most difficult for you. 

Keep up the good work, you're doing great! For your effort, you have earned your first badge here, which you will be credited with as Mega Strategist. Congratulations! 

Remember: 

- Ask your teacher whether you will fill it in on paper or on the computer. 

- If you fill it in on your pc, don't forget to save it on your computer when you finish it!

¿Necesitas más ayuda?

Para concluir, vamos a recordar la estrategia o el “truco” que has aprendido durante este reto. 

Esta estrategia o “truco” te lo enseñamos y lo trabajaste en el apartado “Fasten your seatbelts”. Vuelve a dicho apartado y repasa un momento en qué consistía y cómo te sirvió para llegar a conseguir el reto que te proponíamos. Abre, ahora, el Diario de aprendizaje y completa su última página. 

En este apartado guardarás información valiosa sobre la estrategia, en qué actividades las has aplicado, si ha sido útil y qué te ha resultado más difícil.

¡Sigue trabajando así! ¡Lo estás haciendo genial! Por tu esfuerzo has conseguido aquí la primera insignia que te acreditará como Mega-Estratega. ¡Enhorabuena! 

Recuerda: 

• Pregunta a tu profesor o profesora si rellenarás la ficha en papel o en el ordenador. 

• Si la rellenas en el ordenador, ¡no te olvides de guardarla en tu ordenador cuando la termines!
A travel plan is a really useful tool that will help you not to get lost during your travel moreover than having everything about the travel under control.

All the elements of a travel plan are included in the following interactive travel plan. Have a look at it:

A custom-made trip for you

#1

Set off with the most comfortable means of transport! This trip includes a five-star-night train for the outbound journey and a business class plane ticket for the inbound journey. During our stay in our destination a coach can be available for us 24/7.

#2

This country is unpredictable. It can be cold and it can rain heavily (and you will freeze); and all of the sudden it can be extremely hot (and you will be boiling hot). So pack your luggage carefully! Include summer and winter clothes. Remember the luggage conditions, too: we can only take a backpack and a small suitcase. They can weigh up to twenty kilos.

 

#3

This wonderful trip has two options for the accommodation: you can check into a youth hostel or you can stay with a host family, a perfect option if you want to practise your English abroad.

#4

Every day we will receive a packed lunch to spend the day outside. Breakfast will always be with your host family or in the youth hostel. Dinners are not included. If you want, you can try new flavours in the best restaurants in the city.

#5

#6

The currency is different in this country, so it is advisable to ask for some money at the bank and take pocket money or a credit card abroad.

End

Make it happen. Our guests are absolutely delighted with this vacation. And everything for only €350!

Lectura facilitada

 1. Read

  1. You are going to use this transport on the trip:

1. Tú vas a usar este transporte en el viaje:

  - A luxurious train to go to the destination.

- Un tren lujoso para ir al destino.

 - A plane to go home.

- Un avión para volver a casa.

  - A bus for every day.

- Un autobús para todos los días.

  2. The weather changes suddenly.

2. El tiempo cambia de repente.

  - Pack warm clothes and summer clothes.

Echa ropa de abrigo y ropa de verano.

  - You carry a backpack and a small suitcase.

Llevas una mochila y una maleta pequeña.

  - Your luggage weighs 20 kilos maximum.

Tu equipaje pesa 20 kilos máximo.

  3. You have two housing options:

3. Tienes dos opciones de alojamiento:

  - You stay in a hostel.

- Te quedas en un albergue.

  - You stay in a house.

- Te quedas en una casa.

  4. You have breakfast at home or at the hotel.

4. Desayunas en casa o en el hotel.

  The family or the hotel gives you the lunch. You decide where to eat it.

La familia o el hotel te da el almuerzo.

Tú decides dónde comerlo.

  You dine for free.

Cenas gratis.

  5. Day one: We see the cathedral and the science museum.

5. Día 1: Vemos la catedral y el museo de las ciencias.

  A tour guide shows us the city.

Un guía turístico nos enseña la ciudad.

 In the evening, we have two options:

Por la noche, dos opciones:

  - We go to an escape room.

- Vamos a una escape room.

  - We go to an anime convention.

- Vemos a gente disfrazada de anime.

  Day 2: We go onto a balloon.

Día 2: Montamos en globo.

  We visit the amusement park.

Visitas el parque de atracciones.

  Day 3: We go to the forest.

Día 3: Vamos al bosque.

  We practice kayaking, climbing or paintballing.

Practicas kayak, escalada o paintball.

We go sunbathing.

Tomamos el sol.

  6. The currency is different in this country.

 6. La moneda es diferente en este país.

  Bring some money or a credit card.

Lleva dinero o tarjeta de crédito.

  7. The trip costs € 350.

9. El viaje cuesta 350 euros.

a) Write a title for the slides two to seven in the presentation.

b) Create a mind map including the titles and some of the new words found in the paragraphs.

Shall we organise the trip to Vinci?

In this activity you will learn how to organise a trip to Vinci taking into account the following questions:

  • What will I carry in my luggage?
  • What activities will I do there?
  • What places will I visit?
  • What means of transport will I use?
  • How much money will I need?

Time to close your eyes and imagine you are going to Vinci to meet Leonardo there.

It’s time to close your eyes and think about the different questions you would ask Leonardo. You can ask him about his inventions, his works of art and philosophy. 

Write down every question you want.

Remember to close your eyes, take a deep breath and let your imagination fly!

Información general sobre este recurso educativo
Título Leonardo Da Vinci y el inglés
Descripción

En este Recurso Educativo, para alumnado de 3º de Inglés de Educación Secundaria Obligatoria se vincula a la figura del gran Leonardo da Vinci.

En la sesión de Activities se trabajan más actividades de readings, listenings and videos de Leonardo da Vinci.

La sesión "Boarding Pass to Vinci" tiene dos objetivos:

  • movilizar al alumnado a buscar y seleccionar alternativas para realizar las diferentes partes de un plan de viaje 
  • realizar una presentación de este utilizando un lenguaje persuasivo. Para ello, el alumnado activará y ampliará su repertorio léxico, de estructuras sintácticas y desarrollará las habilidades necesarias para organizar, persuadir y presentar su plan. El alumnado elaborará en grupo un plan de viaje por escrito, en formato digital o papel. A continuación, lo presentará oralmente con el objetivo de convencer a la clase de realizar este viaje.
Autoría Introducción Carmen Tejada Casado
Autoría Activities Cristina Sánchez Fernández
Autoría de nuevo contenido y modificación sesión Boarding Pass to Vinci Sandra Martínez Pérez
Autoría primera versión sesión Boarding Pass to Vinci María Dolores Ávila Martín; Céline Marie C Camerlynck ; Lucía Fernández Paredes
Licencia Creative Commons BY-SA 4.0

Este contenido fue creado con eXeLearning, el editor libre y de fuente abierta diseñado para crear recursos educativos.

Descargar el fichero .elp

Para ello, el alumnado activará y ampliará su repertorio léxico, de estructuras sintácticas y desarrollará las habilidades necesarias para organizar, persuadir y presentar su plan. El alumnado elaborará en grupo un plan de viaje por escrito, en formato digital o papel. A continuación, lo presentará oralmente con el objetivo de convencer a la clase de realizar este viaje.
